intro: Oreogrammitis inconstans, commonly known as the variable wall moss, is a small, creeping moss that thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is characterized by its delicate, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often slightly curled at the tips. The plant typically grows on rocky surfaces, tree trunks, and damp soil, making it a common sight in forested areas. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short, erect stalks and release spores when mature. Oreogrammitis inconstans is a hardy species that demonstrates adaptability to various microhabitats within its ecological range.
